Mike, this is such a great topic you've stumbled on.  Where I work, we are =
doing lots of hiring this year.  Every development engineer candidate that =
comes in gets to do at least two programming problems on the board.  For on=
e of the problems, the question is something like, "Write a function in any=
 language you want (except Perl) to do XXX."  And then once they have that,=
 we ask them to tell us how they'd unit test what they just wrote.

It's a =
rare individual that says, "Damn, now I realize I should have written the u=
nit test FIRST!"  And out of probably 100 candidates in the past few years =
of this approach, not a single candidate has ever actually written a JUnit/=
NUnit/whatever test case first.  But I hold out hope that person will somed=
ay grace our interview room.


Cheers,
Todd.
